Updated November     pm





The UW medicinal herb garden located on the South side of campus near the Chemistry Building is home to a thousand different species of plants and herbs PERIOD

The UW Medicinal Herb Garden was founded in  with the purpose of cultivating plants for medicinal purposes PERIOD These days the plants arent used in research but the garden does offer its visitors a different kind of healing with the chance to rest and recharge among its 1000plus species of herbs PERIOD

The garden just a few minutes walk south of Drumheller Fountain offers a welcome break for people who spend their days in cubicles or windowless offices said Keith Possee the gardener singlehandedly responsible for the beautification and upkeep of the garden PERIOD

People have talked about the relaxation value of gardens for centuries according to Kathleen Wolf a researcher in the social sciences at UWs School of Environmental and Forest Sciences PERIOD But now there is scientific evidence that confirms the importance of parks and gardens to urban spaces PERIOD

As director of the Green Cities Good Health project at the UW Wolf is responsible for curating this evidence from research institutes around the globe and publishing it online for the public to access PERIOD

Parks and gardens arent just pretty she said PERIOD Theyre essential. research collected by the Green Cities Good Health project shows that being in urban nature allows our brains to unwind which in turn combats mental burnout reduces stress and boosts creativity among a host of other benefits PERIOD

We work so hard today to focus our attention on the task at hand whether it be studying for an exam preparing for a lecture or analyzing research Wolf said PERIOD This can deplete our cognitive function. any college student today will recognize this burnout Too much stress causes irritability frustration anger at unsuspecting roommates PERIOD But even a brief moment in nature can help our brains recharge and refocus PERIOD

Theres something about nature that draws our eye its captivating Wolf said PERIOD Especially on a beautiful welldesigned campus like the University of Washington. in addition to improving mental focus just a few minutes in nature can reduce stress levels PERIOD

Many studies collected by Wolfs project show reduced blood pressure and reduced heart rate can happen within minutes of entering a natural setting PERIOD

Wolf notes that while nature is not the wonder substitute for good medical care it does seem to make a positive difference in peoples lives PERIOD

Miranda Lobb an assistant in the UW School of Dentistry finds solace in the warm autumn sunlight surrounded by plants from the Herb Garden with curious names like Chinese Licorice Pipevine and Lizards Tail PERIOD

I just find it a nice quiet peaceful place to get away from everything she said PERIOD

Possee encourages students and faculty alike to take a stroll down to the garden and enjoy its greenery PERIOD Its free open all the time and just might be the reset your brain needs PERIOD



Reach writer Cassi Flintat sciencedailyuw.com.Twitter cassiflint
